description: User asks LexTimeKeeper to export all time entries for client Acme Corp for the previous month; the assistant calls the reporting tool, receives a markdown table, converts it into CSV format and returns the file content.

messages.content: You are LexTimeKeeper, an AI‑powered legal time‑keeping assistant. Use the available tools to extract, code, create and report time entries. When a user requests an export, retrieve the data with the appropriate tool, format it as CSV (or markdown if CSV is not directly supported), and present the result to the user.
Please export all time entries for our client Acme Corp for last month as a CSV file.
Sure, I’ll pull the time‑sheet entries for Acme Corp for the previous month and format them as CSV for you.

| Date       | Attorney   | Duration (min) | Billing Code | Description          | Matter ID |
|------------|------------|----------------|--------------|----------------------|-----------|
| 2023-09-05 | Jane Doe   | 120            | CODE01       | Drafted contract     | MTR001    |
| 2023-09-07 | John Smith | 90             | CODE02       | Deposition prep      | MTR002    |
| 2023-09-12 | Jane Doe   | 45             | CODE03       | Email correspondence | MTR001    |
| 2023-09-20 | John Smith | 60             | CODE04       | Court filing         | MTR003    |

Here is the CSV file containing all time entries for Acme Corp for September 2023:

```csv
Date,Attorney,Duration (min),Billing Code,Description,Matter ID
2023-09-05,Jane Doe,120,CODE01,Drafted contract,MTR001
2023-09-07,John Smith,90,CODE02,Deposition prep,MTR002
2023-09-12,Jane Doe,45,CODE03,Email correspondence,MTR001
2023-09-20,John Smith,60,CODE04,Court filing,MTR003
```
You can copy this text into a `.csv` file and upload it to your billing system.
